001package org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.utils;
002
003import java.io.Serial;
004import java.util.Random;
005import java.util.stream.IntStream;
006
007import static java.util.stream.Collectors.joining;
008import static java.util.stream.IntStream.range;
009import static java.util.stream.IntStream.rangeClosed;
010import static org.apache.commons.lang3.ArrayUtils.swap;
011import static org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.utils.CoreStreamUtils.reversedArr;
012
013/**
014 * Helper-wrapper over standard {@link Random} to generate random arrays and collections
015 */
016public class RandomHelper extends Random {
017
018    @Serial
019    private static final long serialVersionUID = 123456789_002L;
020
021    public RandomHelper() {
022        super(); // non-reproducible random sequences !!!
023    }
024
025    public RandomHelper(long seed) {
026        super(seed);
027    }
028
029    public String randomLowerCase(int len) {
030        return ints(len, 'a', 'z' + 1)
031            .mapToObj(chInt -> (char)chInt)
032            .map(String::valueOf)
033            .collect(joining());
034    }
035
036    public String randomUpperCase(int len) {
037        return ints(len, 'A', 'Z' + 1)
038            .mapToObj(chInt -> (char)chInt)
039            .map(String::valueOf)
040            .collect(joining());
041    }
042
043    /**
044     * @param lowBound lower bound of the range (inclusive)
045     * @param highBound higher bound of the range (exclusive)
046     * @return the array of elements in range {@code [ lowBound ; highBound )} that was shuffled
047     */
048    public int[] randomRangeArr(int lowBound, int highBound) {
049        return shuffle(range(lowBound, highBound));
050    }
051
052    /**
053     * @param lowBound lower bound of the range (inclusive)
054     * @param highBound higher bound of the range (inclusive)
055     * @return the array of elements in range {@code [ lowBound ; highBound ]} that was shuffled
056     */
057    public int[] randomRangeClosedArr(int lowBound, int highBound) {
058        return shuffle(rangeClosed(lowBound, highBound));
059    }
060
061    /**
062     * Collects the passed stream of {@code int}s into an array and shuffle it with {@link #shuffleArr(int[])}
063     *
064     * @param values stream of primitive {@code int}s
065     * @return an array of inpiut elements that are shuffled
066     */
067    public int[] shuffle(IntStream values) {
068        int[] valuesArr = values.toArray();
069        shuffleArr(valuesArr);
070        return valuesArr;
071    }
072
073    /**
074     * Swap elements of the passed array in random way.
075     * The number of swaps equals to the length of array.
076     *
077     * @param valuesArr an array to shuffle
078     */
079    public void shuffleArr(int[] valuesArr) {
080        // a little bit more efficient than using Collections.shuffle and subsequence copying
081        for (int i = valuesArr.length; i > 1; i--) {
082            swap(valuesArr, i - 1, nextInt(valuesArr.length));
083        }
084    }
085
086    public int[] randomDistinctIntArr(long N, int lowBound, int highBound) {
087        return ints(5 * N, lowBound, highBound)
088            .distinct().limit(N).toArray();
089    }
090
091    public int[] randomSortedIntArr(long N, int lowBound, int highBound) {
092        return ints(N, lowBound, highBound)
093            .sorted().limit(N).toArray();
094    }
095
096    public int[] randomSortedReversedIntArr(long N, int lowBound, int highBound) {
097        return reversedArr(randomSortedIntArr(N, lowBound, highBound));
098    }
099
100    public int[] randomIncreasingIntArr(long N, int lowBound, int highBound) {
101        return ints(5 * N, lowBound, highBound)
102            .distinct().limit(N).sorted().toArray();
103    }
104
105    public int[] randomDecreasingIntArr(long N, int lowBound, int highBound) {
106        return reversedArr(randomIncreasingIntArr(N, lowBound, highBound));
107    }
108
109    public int[] zeroIntArr(long N) {
110        return constantIntArr(N, 0);
111    }
112
113    public int[] constantIntArr(long N, int constant) {
114        return IntStream.generate(() -> constant).limit(N).toArray();
115    }
116}
